ML_AA_NAMES.AA_NAME: The European Joint Undertaking for ITER and the Development of Fusion Energy ("Fusion for Energy")

ADDRESS_CONTRACTING_BODY.OFFICIALNAME: The European Joint Undertaking for ITER and the Development of Fusion Energy ("Fusion for Energy")
ADDRESS_CONTRACTING_BODY.ADDRESS: C/ Josep Pla 2, Torres Diagonal Litoral, Edificio B3, Office 22/10

TITLE.P: Ion source and Extraction Power Supplies

SHORT_DESCR.P: The overall scope of the procurement is the design, manufacture, factory testing, delivery, installation and acceptance testing of a minimum of two and up to four Ion Source and Extraction Power Supplies (ISEPS) systems for the production of negative Deuterium or Hydrogen ions to be accelerated and neutralized in the Neutral Beam Injectors of ITER experiment and of PRIMA facility.
For the purpose of this procurement procedure the supply will be split in four distinct and successive stages.

Each stage is made up of one individual unit of Ion Source and Extraction Power Supply and should enter into force sequentially and in accordance with the schedule provided in section 12 of Annex B – Technical Specification.

Please note that for the purpose of this procurement procedure the entry into force of Stages 3 and 4 is to be treated as an option (Options A and B) and will be subject to the approval from Fusion for Energy before their respective entry into force.
1. Stage 1 consists of the supply of one ISEPS unit for the ion source experiment (SPIDER). It shall be delivered and installed at the PRIMA site located in Padua, Italy.
2. Stage 2 consists of the supply of one ISEPS unit for the full size Neutral Beam Injector experiment (MITICA). It shall be delivered and installed at the PRIMA site located in Padua, Italy.
Stages 1 and 2 constitute the baseline supply.

3. Stage 3 consists of the supply of one ISEPS unit for the first ITER Heating Neutral Beam Injector (referred to as IHNB1). It shall be delivered and installed at the ITER site, Cadarache, France (Option A).

4. Stage 4 consists of the supply of one ISEPS unit for the second ITER Heating Neutral Beam Injector (referred to as IHNB2). It shall be delivered and installed at the ITER site, Cadarache, France. (Option B).

TITLE.P: Ion Source and Extraction Power Supplies

SHORT_DESCR.P: The overall scope of the procurement is the design, manufacture, factory testing, delivery, installation and acceptance testing of a minimum of two and up to four Ion Source and Extraction Power Supplies (ISEPS) systems for the production of negative Deuterium or Hydrogen ions to be accelerated and neutralized in the Neutral Beam Injectors of ITER experiment and of PRIMA facility.
For the purpose of this procurement procedure the supply will be split in four distinct and successive stages.

Each stage is made up of one individual unit of Ion Source and Extraction Power Supply and should enter into force sequentially and in accordance with the schedule provided in section 12 of Annex B – Technical Specification.

Please note that for the purpose of this procurement procedure the entry into force of Stages 3 and 4 is to be treated as an option (Options A and B) and will be subject to the approval from Fusion for Energy before their respective entry into force.
1. Stage 1 consists of the supply of one ISEPS unit for the ion source experiment (SPIDER). It shall be delivered and installed at the PRIMA site located in Padua, Italy.
2. Stage 2 consists of the supply of one ISEPS unit for the full size Neutral Beam Injector experiment (MITICA). It shall be delivered and installed at the PRIMA site located in Padua, Italy.
Stages 1 and 2 constitute the baseline supply.

3. Stage 3 consists of the supply of one ISEPS unit for the first ITER Heating Neutral Beam Injector (referred to as IHNB1). It shall be delivered and installed at the ITER site, Cadarache, France (Option A).

4. Stage 4 consists of the supply of one ISEPS unit for the second ITER Heating Neutral Beam Injector (referred to as IHNB2). It shall be delivered and installed at the ITER site, Cadarache, France. (Option B).

Earlier modifications were implemented to record the novation of the contract to Energy Technology SRL, review payment/option release terms, update interfaces with components from other supply contracts, resolve on-site installation issues and apply new regulatory requirements.

The scope of this modification is to propagate the amendments introduced to the first ISEPS unit, SPIDER, to the second unit, MITICA. The modifications include scope rationalization/simplification (identical dummy load, de-scoping of minor PS), interface-related adjustments and refinement of requirements (ventilation system control, interface with interlock and control system), enhancement of system reliability (separate cooling loops for aluminum and copper components).

ADDITIONAL_NEED.P: The modifications consist mainly of design adjustments (extra features, revised functionalities, characteristics of external interfaces) of existing components and systems and thus a change of contractor is not suitable.
